```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(randomForest)
library(caret)
```

```{r prepare volkswagen data, warning = FALSE, message=FALSE}
source("./data-clean.R")
source("./ML_utils.R")
source("./quotaSample.R")

vw <- prepareBrandDataset(autoData(), "volkswagen")
# number of models to predict:
length(unlist(unique(vw[, "model"])))
```
``` {r prepare}
#small dataset with pre-cleaning
dataset <- quotaSample(vw,
                       4000,
                       c("model", "fuelType", "gearbox", "notRepairedDamage"))

#setup
seed <- 798
metric <- "Accuracy"
control <- trainControl(method="cv", number=4)
preProc <- c("center", "scale")
```


## learning 
``` {r learning}
results <- resamples(
  c(sapply(X = c("nb", "rpart", "rf", "C5.0", "treebag", "PART", "J48"), #gbm?
         FUN = defModelFit,
         seed = seed,
         form = model ~ .,
         data = dataset,
         metric = metric,
         trControl = control,
         simplify = FALSE,
         USE.NAMES = TRUE),
    sapply(X = c("svmRadial", "knn"), # glmnet ?
         FUN = defModelFit,
         seed = seed,
         form = model ~ .,
         data = dataset,
         metric = metric,
         trControl = control,
         preProcess = c("center", "scale"),
         simplify = FALSE,
         USE.NAMES = TRUE)))
summary(results)
```

## plot
``` {r figures}
# boxplot comparison
bwplot(results)
# Dot-plot comparison
dotplot(results)
```
